intro: Wiborgiella vlokii, commonly known as the Vlok's rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many well-known edible and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
